name: 2-7 Single Draw
description:
1. Each player is dealt five cards
2. Round of betting
3. May exchange up to 3 cards
4. Round of betting

Winner is player with lowest hand. Unlike lowball, aces are high, and straights and flushes count as high.

name: 2-7 Triple Draw
description:
1. Each player is dealt five cards
2. Round of betting
3. May exchange up to 3 cards
4. Round of betting
5. May exchange up to 3 cards
6. Round of betting
7. May exchange up to 3 cards
8. Round of betting

Winner is player with lowest hand. Unlike lowball, aces are high, and straights and flushes count as high.

A hand consists of the following:

* Ante, deal 3 down to each player
* Threes are wild
* Players go around the table declaring in or out
* If two players are in, they exchange cards without exposing to other players. The loser must pay the winner the amount in the pot.
* If a player declares in after more than one other person, that player may choose which player to play against. They may then choose to play against any of the other players that are in.
* If a player declares in, and nobody after him calls in, the players who passed before him get a last chance to declare in (only one person may go in against him)
* If nobody calls an in player, that person gains a leg.
* Ante again, each player **keeps their three cards** and is dealt two more. 
* Threes are no longer wild, fives are now wild.
* Players once again go around the table declaring in or out
* Ante again, each player **keeps their five cards** and is dealt two more. 
* Fives are no longer wild, sevens are now wild.
* Players once again go around the table declaring in or out

A player doesn't have to be in one round to be in the next. 
Play continues as above until a player gets a second leg. That player collects the pot.

* Deal each player four down cards, deal four community cards (down)
* Round of betting
* Reveal one community card at a time, with a round of betting after each
* Cards matching between hand and community are wild
* Winner is best five card hand

Counting Game

* Deal one down to start, then all up with round of betting after each player gets one
* Aces are worth 1 or 11
* Face cards are worth 0.5
* Continue until nobody takes a card
* Final round of betting

Pot is split between:
1. Closest to 21 without going over
2. Closest to 6.5 (lower beats higher)
   For example: 6 beats a 7

* Blackjack counting rules
* Deal one card initially, bet
* Pot is split between closest to 7 and closest to 27 without going over
* Allowed to take one card at a time, followed by round of betting
* One final round of betting when nobody takes a card

name: Acey Deucey
description:
* Deal two cards face up.
* Player must wager odds that next card is between those two.
* If next card is between the two, take that amount from the pot
* If the next card is outside of the two, pay that amount into the pot
* If the next card is one of those two, player must double the pot
* If the two dealt cards are the same or one apart, that player is skipped.
* Play continues until one player wins the pot. Cards are dealt without shuffling until the deck is depleted.
* If an ace is the first card, player must call low or high before the next card is dealt. 
* If an ace is the second card, it is treated as high

Option: Players may only wager half the pot for the first round

name: Al's Game
description:
1. Each player is dealt a down card. 
2. Each player may choose to receive a card faceup, or reveal their down card and receive a card facedown.
3. A round of betting is initiated by the player with the best poker hand showing.
4. Repeat steps 2-3 until each player has one down card and four up cards.
5. Showdown

The hole card is wild.

name: Anaconda
description:
1. Deal each player 7 cards
2. Bet
3. Pass three cards left
4. Bet
5. Pass two cards left
6. Bet
7. Pass one card left
8. Bet
9. Each player discards two cards (face down)
10. Roll one card at a time, with a round of betting after each

Pot is split between high and low hands

name: Badugi
description:
1. Players are dealt 4 cards
2. Round of betting
3. May exchange up to 4 cards (3 times, each followed by betting round)


Badugi hands are ranked as follows:
4 card hand > 3 card hand > 2 card hand > 1 card hand
If two cards share either a suit or a rank, one is not counted as part of a hand. 

Lowest hand wins. 

Best possible hand (all four suits, ace, 2, 3, 4): [card:ace of clubs][card:2 of diamonds][card:3 of hearts][card:4 of spades]

name: Baseball
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]
* Threes and Nines are wild
* Players dealt a four get the option to buy an extra card
* Option - Down fours don't get an extra card

name: Best Flush
description:
[game:Five Card Stud]

Winner is player with best flush. 
Rankings are as follows:
1. Straight flush
2. Five card flush
3. Four card flush
4. Three card flush
5. Two card flush

name: Bid Poker
description:
* Set minimum bid price
* Deal 5 cards to each player
* Deal 5 cards face down to the center
* Reveal a card
* Player to dealers left must bid at least the minimum
* Bid goes around the table, with either a higher bid or pass
* Players who pass may not bid again
* Player who bids while everyone passes gets card for that price
* Next card is exposed and next player starts bid
* Declare High/Low for showdown

name: Blood and Guts
description:
Like [game:Guts], only players are dealt one card face up. 

Player with highest up card has to be in.

name: Cincinnati
description:
1. Five cards down to each player, five cards down to community.
2. Round of betting
3. Reveal on card at a time followed by a round of betting, until all cards are revealed

Best five card hand wins using all ten cards

name: Clint's Game
description: Same as [game:Trees], but pot is split between high hand and best [game:badugi] hand

name: Cow Pies
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

The pot is split between best 5 card hand and best 2 card hand (not the same cards in each)

name: Criss-Cross
description:
1. Five cards are dealt down to each player. Five cards are dealt face down in a cross in the center.
2. Round of betting
3. One card is revealed, followed by a round of betting, until all cards are revealed (center is last to be revealed)

Options:
* Match and the cards are wild
* Center card is wild

Winner is best hand between hole cards and 3 linear community cards (horizontal or vertical)

name: Double Lowball
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

* Low hand gets half of pot
* Low spots gets half of pot

Spots: Center dots on cards:

[card:ace of spades]:1

[card:two of spades]:2

[card:three of spades]:3

[card:four of spades]:0

[card:five of spades]:1

[card:six of spades]:0

[card:seven of spades]:1

[card:eight of spades]:2

[card:nine of spades]:1

[card:ten of spades]:2

[card:jack of spades]:0

[card:queen of spades]:0

[card:king of spades]:0

name: Elbows
description: Like [game:Criss-Cross], but instead of using linear community cards, players must use one of the four right angle triples formed.

name: Five Aces or You're an Asshole
description:
1. Five cards dealt to each player, five face down to community
2. Round of betting
3. Reveal one card at a time, followed by betting round, until each card is revealed.

Cards that match between a player's hole cards and community cards are wilds (so get two wilds at once)
Best five card hand from five hole cards and five community wins.

name: Five Card Baseball
description:
1. Deal one card down, one up to each player.
2. Round of betting
3. Deal another up card
4. Round of betting
5. Repeat 3-4 until each player has 5 cards

Nines and threes are wild
Each player who is dealt a wild must match the pot or fold
Player dealt an up four immediately receives another card

name: Five Card Draw
description:
1. Each player is dealt 5 cards.
2. Player to dealer's left starts a round of betting.
3. Each player may exchange up to 3 cards (4 if he reveals an ace as his remaining card).
4. Player two positions to left of dealer begins a round of betting.
5. Showdown for pot.

name: Five Card Draw - High/Low Split
description: Played the same as [game:Five Card Draw], except pot is split between high and low hands (straights and flushes don't count).

name: Five Card Draw - Jacks or Back
description:
1. Each player is dealt 5 cards
2. Player must have a pair of jacks or better to open betting. 
3. If there is no bet, the game switches to lowball.
4. Players may exchange up to 3 cards (4 if revealing other card to be an ace)
5. Round of betting.
6. Showdown

name: Five Card Draw - Jacks or Better
description:
1. Players are dealt 5 cards each
2. Only a player dealt a pair of jacks or better may open the bet.
3. If there is no bet, the hand is dead, there is another ante and hand is redealt.
4. If there is a bet, the player who opened must show their hand at some point (before trading cards away or folding)

name: Five Card Draw - Jacks to Open, Trips to win
description: Same as [game:Five Card Draw - Jacks or Better] except a player must have at least 3 of a kind to win, or the hand is redealt. (Only players still in ante and play again)

name: Five Card Draw - Lowball
description: Played the same as [game:Five Card Draw], only winner is player with lowest hand (straights and flushes don't count as high).

name: Five Card Draw - Roll Cards
description:
1. Each player is dealt 5 cards
2. Round of betting
3. Each player may exchange up to 3 cards (4 if revealing an ace as remaining card)
4. Round of betting
5. Each player chooses one card to reveal.
6. Betting starts with player with best hand showing
7. Repeat steps 5-6 until all cards are revealed.

name: Five Card Stud
description:
1. Each player is dealt one card facedown and one card faceup.
2. A round of betting is started by player with highest poker hand showing.
3. Each player is dealt an up card
4. A round of betting is started by player with highest poker hand showing.
5. Steps 3-4 are repeated until each player has five cards (four up, one down)

name: Five Card Stud - Aces or Better to Win
description: [game:Five Card Stud], only if nobody has at least a pair of aces, cards are redealt and betting continues.

name: Five Card Stud - High Chicago
description:
[game:Five Card Stud]

Pot is split between high hand and player with highest spade in the hole

name: Five Card Stud - Lowball
description: Played the same as [game:Five Card Stud], but with lowest hand winning (straights and flushes no counting against a player, and aces being low)

name: Five Card Stud - Lowball with Replacement
description: [game:Five Card Stud - Lowball], except after last card is dealt, player has option to replace one card, followed by another round of betting

name: Five Card Stud - Low Chicago
description:
[game:Five Card Stud]

Pot is split between high hand and player with lowest spade in the hole

name: Five Card Stud - Power
description:
[game:Five Card Stud]

Once the last card has been dealt, the player with the best poker hand showing may choose to either play the hand, or redeal a new hand.

If redeal is chosen, only players that have not folded play. Ante and continue as before.

name: Good vs. Evil
description:
1. Five cards dealt to each player
2. Two rows of five cards dealt to community (ten total)
3. One row is good, may be used by any player
4. Other row is evil, cards of same rank must be thrown away immediately
5. If a card in the good row is matched by an evil row, the card is evil.
5. Bet after initial deal, expose a good and evil card, bet, etc
6. Declare, showdown
7. High/low split

Option: If a player loses all cards, they win instantly

name: Guts
description:
* Each player is dealt three cards down
* Players place a chip in their hand if in, none if out
* Players reveal simultaneously who is in

A player who is in when nobody else is takes the pot.
A player with the best hand when multiple people are in, gets paid the amount in the pot from each of the players who were in and lost.


Option: If nobody stays in, player with best hand has to pay half the pot into the pot

name: Heartbreak
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

In this version of seven card stud, during the last card dealt face up, if a player is dealt a heart they must fold.

name: High Tide / Low Tide
description: Same as [game:Spit in the Ocean], except pot is split between high and low hands.

name: Hurricane
description:
1. Players are dealt 2 cards
2. Round of betting
3. Players may draw up to 2 cards
4. Round of betting
5. Declare High/Low
6. Showdown

Option: Deuces wild

name: Lamebrain Pete
description: [game:Cinncinnati], with lowest community card and all like it wild.

name: Limbo
description:
* Each player is dealt 6 cards face down (not allowed to look). 
* Deal seven cards face up on the table. Pick the best 5 card hand and discard the other two.
* Player to left of dealer exposes a single card, round of betting
* Next player exposes cards until they have the best hand on the table, round of betting
* If a player's hand is better than the hand in the center, they fold
* Play continues until one player is left, with best hand that doesn't beat the center

name: Midnight Baseball
description:
1. Seven cards are dealt to each player
2. Player to left of dealer reveals a card, round of betting.
3. Next player reveals cards one at a time until they have the best poker hand on the table. Round of betting.
4. If a player reveals all cards and doesn't have best hand, automatically folds.
5. Play continues until one player is left

Rules of Baseball:
1. Threes and Nines are wild
2. Player has option to buy an extra card when a four is revealed

name: Mississippi Stud
description:
Adapted from casino game

1. Each player is dealt two cards face down
2. Round of betting
3. A community card is dealt
4. Round of betting
5. Repeat 3-4 two more times
6. Showdown (two hole cards, three community)

name: New Hampshire Lowdown
description:
* Hole card and matching rank are wild
* Each player is dealt two cards down
* Round of betting
* Each player must choose to expose one card
* Round of betting
* Choose up or down for next card (if down, must expose hole card)
* Round of betting
* Continues until all players have four up cards and one down

Low hand wins

name: No-peek
description:
1. Seven cards are dealt to each player
2. Player to left of dealer reveals a card, round of betting.
3. Next player reveals cards one at a time until they have the best poker hand on the table. Round of betting.
4. If a player reveals all cards and doesn't have best hand, automatically folds.
5. Play continues until one player is left

name: Omaha
description:
1. Each player is dealt four down cards
2. Round of betting
3. A card is burnt and three community cards are dealt
4. Round of betting
5. A card is burnt and a fourth community card is dealt
6. Round of betting
7. A card is burnt and a fifth community card is dealt
8. Final round of betting

Winner is player with best five card hand using two of their hole cards and three of the community (no more, no less)

name: Omaha High / Low
description:
1. Each player is dealt four down cards
2. Round of betting
3. A card is burnt and three community cards are dealt
4. Round of betting
5. A card is burnt and a fourth community card is dealt
6. Round of betting
7. A card is burnt and a fifth community card is dealt
8. Final round of betting

Winner of high hand is player with best five card hand using two of their hole cards and three of the community (no more, no less)
Winner of low hand is player with best five card hand using two of their hole cards and three of the community (no more, no less). The low hand must be eight high or lower, or the high hand takes the entire pot.

name: Piles (Pass the trash)
description:
* Each player starts with three piles of chips
* Each player is dealt one card
* Player to dealer's left may keep his card or exchange with player to his left
* Dealer has option to keep his card or take top card from deck
* Aces are low
* Player holding a king may reject a pass
* Lowest hand loses a pile

Play continues **without reshuffling the deck** until the deck is depleted or only one person has any piles remaining

name: Ralph
description:
* Each player is dealt a three card hand face down
* Two four card hands are dealt in the center
* Each player has four choices
   1. Stay in
   2. Be out
   3. Take one of the four card hands (must be in)
   4. Exchange a single card (must be in)
* Must match pot to winner
* If only one player is in, that person takes the pot

Ante, shuffle, and deal new hands until winning conditions are met

name: Razz
description: [game:Seven Card Stud] lowball

name: Rexticles
description:
A modified version of [game:The Good, the Bad, and The Ugly]

The difference being that cards are laid in the center as follows: three goods, two bads, and one ugly (The Rexticle)

name: Schneiders
description:
1. Ante, declare two wilds, deal two down to each player
2. Deal nine community cards in a square face up
3. Players must use three cards in a row (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) to combine with two hole cards to make best five card hand
4. Players must declare in or out (either drop method, or by hiding a chip in their hand and revealing to declare in)
5. Best hand wins, other players must pay winner the amount in the pot
6. Game ends when one person stays in and nobody else does.

Ante between rounds.

name: Seven Card Stud
description:
1. Each player is dealt two cards down and one up
2. Round of betting
3. Each player dealt one card up.
4. Round of betting
5. Repeat 3-4 until each player has 4 cards up.
6. Deal a last card down
7. Final round of betting

Winner is best 5 card hand

name: Seven Card Stud - Follow the Queen
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Queens are wild
The last card following the last up queen is wild.

Cards following a queen are treated as wild until another queen is revealed.

name: Seven Card Stud - High Chicago
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Pot is split between high hand and player with highest spade in the hole

name: Seven Card Stud - Low Chicago
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Pot is split between high hand and player with lowest spade in the hole

name: Seven Card Stud - Low in the Hole is Wild
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Low Card in the hole is wild, as are matching rank cards. 
i.e. if player has [card:two of clubs][card:7 of spades], each two that player has is considered wild.

May give the option to allow players to choose whether they receive their last card up or down.

name: Seven Card Stud - Power
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Once the last card has been dealt, the player with the best poker hand showing may choose to either play the hand, or redeal a new hand. 

If redeal is chosen, only players that have not folded play. 
Ante and continue as before.

name: Shit on your neighbor
description: Played like [game:Piles (Pass the trash)], except paired cards are safe from elimination

name: Shotgun
description:
1. Each player is dealt 3 cards.
2. Round of betting
3. Each player is dealt a 4th card.
4. Round of betting
5. Each player is dealt a 5th card.
6. Final round of betting
7. Showdown

name: Spit in the Ocean
description:
1. Players are dealt 4 cards down, with one community card dealt faceup whenever a player says "Spit!" (Dealer deals next card to community and continues deal.)
2. Community cards is wild, as are the cards of the same rank

name: Stud-Jack
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

In this version of seven card stud, the hole cards are treated as a blackjack hand. Players may choose to take their last card up or down (dealer may charge to the pot for this). The pot is split between the best poker hand and the best hole blackjack hand.

name: Texas Hold'em
description:
1. Each player is dealt two down cards
2. Round of betting
3. A card is burnt and three community cards are dealt
4. Round of betting
5. A card is burnt and a fourth community card is dealt
6. Round of betting
7. A card is burnt and a fifth community card is dealt
8. Final round of betting

Winner is player with best five card hand between hole cards and community

name: The Good, the Bad, and The Ugly
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

Three cards are placed in the middle. 
The first to be flipped, "The Good", sets a wild
The second to be flipped, "The Bad", must be thrown away
The third to be flipped, "The Ugly", kills a hand
Any good may also be an ugly. 

For example, if the three cards are [card:ten of spades][card:five of hearts][card:jack of diamonds]:

These cards are wild: [card:ten of hearts][card:ten of diamonds][card:ten of clubs]

These cards must be thrown away: [card:five of diamonds][card:five of clubs][card:five of spades]

Any player with these must immediately fold:[card:jack of hearts][card:jack of clubs][card:jack of spades]

The dealer may call the option of having a "buy back" cards, where a player may pay a set amount to return one card before the ugly is flipped.

The dealer has the option of revealing the good, the bad, and the ugly after any round of betting.

name: Three Card Substitution
description:
Dealt like [game:Five Card Stud]

After each player has five cards, the player to the left of the player with the lowest card showing may substitute any card for 1X the ante. Each player gets the same opportunity.

Round of betting

Player to left of the player with the lowest card showing may substitute any card for 2X the ante. Each player gets the same opportunity.

Round of betting

Player to left of the player with the lowest card showing may substitute any card for 3X the ante. Each player gets the same opportunity.

Round of betting

Showdown

name: Trees
description:
1. Deal every player five cards face down
2. Bet
3. Call trades open
4. Players trade equal numbers of cards amongst themselves
5. Trade is done when everyone is satisfied, or set time passes
6. Roll one card at a time with a bet after each

Split between high and low

name: Turkey
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud]

During each up card dealt, a card is revealed to the community and there is a bid on that card to replace a card in the player's hand. High bidder gets the card.

name: Two-Thirds
description:
Normal [game:Seven Card Stud], but winner must have two of three:

1. Best 5 card hand
2. Highest Spade in the hole
3. Lowest Spade in the hole

Otherwise, the pot rolls over and a new hand is dealt.

name: Use and Lose
description: [game:Good vs. Evil], split between high hand and lowest total counting (Aces are worth 1, face cards 10, other cards their rank)

name: Utah
description: [game:Cinncinnati], with center community card and all like it wild

name: Zero
description:
* Red cards are negative
* Black cards are positive
* Deal 1 up, 1 down
* Round of betting
* may take an additional card, one at a time, up to 5x (with a round of betting in between each)

Closest to zero wins

name: Pineapple
description:
Variant of [game:Texas Hold'em] with one extra starting card.

* Each player is dealt three hole cards
* Players must discard one card before the flop
* Flop is dealt (3 community cards)
* Round of betting
* Turn is dealt (1 community card)
* Round of betting
* River is dealt (1 community card)
* Final round of betting

Players make their best five-card hand using their remaining two hole cards and the five community cards.

name: Crazy Pineapple
description:
Variant of [game:Pineapple] where the discard happens after seeing the flop instead of before.

* Each player is dealt three hole cards
* Flop is dealt (3 community cards)
* Round of betting
* Players must discard one card after the flop
* Turn is dealt (1 community card)
* Round of betting
* River is dealt (1 community card)
* Final round of betting

Players make their best five-card hand using their remaining two hole cards and the five community cards. Discarding after the flop adds more strategic decision-making than regular Pineapple.

name: Irish Poker
description:
Hybrid between [game:Omaha] and [game:Texas Hold'em]. Starts like Omaha but ends like Hold'em.

* Each player is dealt four hole cards
* Flop is dealt (3 community cards)
* Round of betting
* Players must discard two cards after the flop
* Turn is dealt (1 community card)
* Round of betting
* River is dealt (1 community card)
* Final round of betting

Players make their best five-card hand using their remaining two hole cards and the five community cards. The discard decision after seeing the flop is crucial.

name: Mexican Stud
description:
Variant of [game:Five Card Stud] where players control which cards are exposed.

* Each player is dealt two cards face down
* Players look at their cards and choose one to flip face up
* Round of betting
* Deal one card face down to each player
* Players choose one of their down cards to flip face up
* Round of betting
* Continue dealing cards face down with players choosing which to flip until each player has 5 cards
* Final round of betting

Also known as Flip or Peep. Players always have control over which cards are exposed, adding a layer of deception not present in standard stud games.

name: Iron Cross
description:
Community card game similar to [game:Cinncinnati] and [game:Criss-Cross] but with unique layout and usage rules.

* Each player is dealt five hole cards face down
* Deal five community cards in a cross/plus pattern (one center, four on edges) face down
* Flip the center community card
* Round of betting
* Flip one of the outer community cards
* Round of betting
* Flip another outer card
* Round of betting
* Flip another outer card
* Round of betting
* Flip the final outer card
* Final round of betting

Players must use the center card plus one entire row (vertical or horizontal) from the cross to make their best hand with their hole cards. Strategic element comes from choosing which row to use.

name: Push
description:
Pure bluffing game similar to [game:Guts] but with sequential dealing. Related to [game:No-peek] in that cards stay hidden.

* Deal one card face down to each player
* Round of betting, players can fold or stay in
* Deal another card face down to remaining players
* Another round of betting with option to fold
* Continue dealing one card at a time with betting rounds until 7 cards are dealt or only one player remains
* No cards are ever shown during the hand
* Final showdown if multiple players remain

Players must decide to stay or fold without seeing other players' cards. Psychological game focused on reading opponents and betting patterns rather than actual card strength.

name: Screwy Louie
description:
[game:Seven Card Stud] variant with personal wild cards. Similar concept to [game:Baseball] but wilds are determined by each player's lowest card.

* Deal one card down, one card up to each player
* Round of betting
* Deal one card up
* The lowest card showing is wild for that player (and all matching cards in their hand)
* Round of betting
* Deal one card up
* The lowest card showing is wild for that player
* Round of betting
* Deal one card up
* The lowest card showing is wild for that player
* Round of betting
* Deal final card down
* The lowest card in each player's hand (including down cards) is wild for that player
* Final round of betting

Wild cards change throughout the hand as new cards are revealed. Each player has their own personal wild card rank, making it impossible to know exactly what opponents might have.

name: Murder
description:
Progressive pot-matching game similar to [game:357] but with different wild card progression.

* Ante, deal 3 cards down to each player
* Threes are wild
* Players declare in or out around the table
* Players who are in play against each other (loser matches pot)
* If multiple players declare in, they choose opponents or play in pairs
* If nobody calls an in player, that player gains a leg
* Players keep their three cards and receive 2 more
* Sixes are now wild (threes are no longer wild)
* Another round of in/out declarations
* Players keep their five cards and receive 2 more
* Nines are now wild (sixes are no longer wild)
* Final round of in/out declarations

Play continues until a player gets a second leg and collects the pot. Like 357, pots can grow very large.

name: Pitch
description:
Trick-taking game where players bid on how many points they can score.

* Deal 6 cards to each player
* Bidding round (minimum bid of 2, maximum of 4)
* Highest bidder names trump suit and leads first trick
* Players must follow suit if able, otherwise may play any card
* Highest trump wins trick; if no trump, highest card of led suit wins
* Points available each hand:
  - High: player dealt highest trump (1 point)
  - Low: player dealt lowest trump (1 point)
  - Jack: player winning trick with jack of trump (1 point)
  - Game: player with highest point total from captured cards (1 point)
    * 10s = 10 points, Aces = 4, Kings = 3, Queens = 2, Jacks = 1
* If bidder makes their bid, they score their points
* If bidder fails, they go "set" and lose that many points (must match pot)
* Other players always score the points they take

Also known as Setback or High Low Jack. Partners variation available for 4 players.

name: Bourre
description:
Trick-taking pot-matching game popular in Louisiana. Also spelled Booray or Bour.

* Ante to the pot
* Deal 5 cards to each player
* Flip one card to determine trump suit
* Players declare in or out (must win at least one trick if in)
* Players who are in may discard and draw up to 5 new cards
* Player to dealer's left leads first trick
* Must follow suit if able; if unable, must play trump if able
* Highest trump wins trick; if no trump, highest card of led suit wins
* Winner of trick leads next
* After all tricks played:
  - Player who won most tricks wins the pot
  - Players who declared in but won no tricks are "bourred" and must match the pot
  - If tie for most tricks, pot carries over to next hand

Pots can grow exponentially when multiple players get bourred. Some variations require winning 3 of 5 tricks to take the pot.

name: In-Between
description:
Pot-matching game similar to [game:Acey Deucey] but with different betting structure. Also known as Yablon or Sheets.

* Ante to build starting pot
* Deal two cards face up to first player
* Player bets any amount up to the pot size that third card will fall between the two
* Deal third card:
  - If between the two cards: player wins that amount from pot
  - If outside the two cards: player pays that amount into pot
  - If matches either card: player pays double their bet into pot
* If cards are consecutive or equal, player's turn is skipped
* Continue around table until pot is won or all players have gone
* Aces are always high

The spread between cards determines odds:
* One-card spread (e.g., 7-9): 11-1 against
* Two-card spread (e.g., 7-10): 5-1 against
* Three-card spread: 3-1 against

Pots can grow very large when players get unlucky or greedy.
